'''''alcar''''' is [[Quenya]] for "glory".<ref>{{S|Appendix}}, entry ''[[aglar]]''</ref><ref name=RGEO>{{RGEO|Notes}}, note 3, p. 65</ref>

==Etymology==
[[Root]] [[KAL]] ("light; shine, be bright").<ref>{{PE|17}}, entry S '''aglar''', p. 24 and root KAL-, p. 156</ref>

==Examples==
* ''[[Alcarinquë|'''Alcar'''inquë]]'' = "Glorious"
* ''[[Atanalcar|Atan'''alcar''']]'' = "Man Glory"
* ''[[Alcar mi Tarmenel na Erun]]'' = "glory to God in the highest"
* ''[[Oath of Eorl|Elenna·nóreo '''alcar''']]'' = "the glory of the Land of the Star"

==Cognates==
The [[Sindarin]] form is ''[[aglar]]''.<ref name=RGEO/>
